intro: Kleinia crassulifolia, commonly known as the rock fig or silverleaf kleiniabush, is a succulent shrub native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and fleshy, silver-green leaves that are covered in a waxy cuticle. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters during the warmer months. It is well adapted to arid and rocky environments, storing water in its thick leaves and stems. Kleinia crassulifolia is often used in rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental appearance.
